snippet: Foreign organizations operating in Pakistan were told they faced greater scrutiny and the possibility of expulsion if they failed to adhere to unspecified rules and laws.
abstract: Chaudhry Nisar Ali Khan, Pakistan's interior minister, issues warning to foreign organizations in country that they will face increased scrutiny and may be expelled if they fail to adhere to unspecified rules and laws; warning comes day after authorities sealed Islamabad offices of NGO Save the Children for alleged 'anti-Pakistan' activities; crackdown on NGOs is occurring amid clampdown on freedom of expression and movement.

byline.contributor: Declan Walsh contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: Foreign organizations operating in Pakistan were told they faced greater scrutiny and the possibility of expulsion if they failed to adhere to unspecified rules and laws.

headline.main: Pakistan Warns Aid Groups to Follow Unspecified Rules
headline.print_headline: Pakistan Warns Aid Groups to Follow Unspecified Rules

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
